identificationModule.briefTitle: Effect of Local Pressure on Muscle Activity and General Relaxation in Persons With Hypertonia Following Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effect of Local Pressure Application on Muscle Activity and General Relaxation in Persons With Hypertonia Following Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to examine the effect of - both constant as intermittent - local application of deep pressure on muscle activity and general relaxation in persons with hypertonia following stroke.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This study will be carried out in 20 persons with hypertonia following stroke. There will be one single test occasion, during which 6 test trials will be performed in random order. Deep pressure will be applied by means of a Johnstone air splint, that will be (1) not inflated, (2) inflated constantly, or (3) inflated intermittently. Each of these 3 inflation conditions will be performed twice, i.e. with and without a non-hemiplegic arm movement (triggering hypertonia at hemiplegic side).

interventions.name: constant deep pressure applied by an air splint
interventions.description: inflation of the Johnstone air splint gives a constant local deep pression on the hemiplegic arm

interventions.name: intermittent deep pressure applied by an air splint
interventions.description: continuous inflation and deflation of the Johnstone air splint gives an intermittent local deep pression on the hemiplegic arm

interventions.name: uninflated air splint
interventions.description: no deep pressure applied by the air splint

interventions.name: contralateral movement
interventions.description: non-hemiplegic arm is flexed and extended 5 times, with a weight of 5kg in the hand, in order to trigger hypertonia in the hemiplegic arm
